content: lwahs teud dik & bmal eht rof rettink tsulrednaw eht iksworut nyltiac yb abbreviations duet shawl is a performance of two yarns coming together to perform on your bobble bind off needles combining the lamb & kid with lolabean yarn co this simple yet satisfying garter stitch elongated triangle shawl is the perfect instrument to show off these two co cast on amazing yarns the duet shawl is a rhythmic knit that is perfect to knit with friends k knit kfb knit into the front and back of the stitch 1 stitch increased the details k2tog knit 2 stitches together 1 stitch decreased materials needles lhn left hand needle the lamb & kid clarence 100% fine needles listed are suggested m marker merino wool 185 yards per 100g 2 skeins gauge needle us 8 5mm 32 / m1l with yarn in back insert 80cm circular needles or longer left-hand needle under the hori- lolabean yarn co otebo bean 100% zontal strand between stitch just merino wool 213 yards per 115g 2 skeins tools worked and next stitch from the front to back knit through back or stitch markers tapestry needle loop 1 stitch increased mc approximately 370 yards / 336 m1r with yarn in back insert meters of an aran weight yarn pattern notes left-hand needle under the hori- zontal strand between stitch just cc approximately 350 yards / 320 this garter stitch elongated triangle worked and next stitch from the meters of an aran weight yarn shawl is co with a garter tab co and back to front knit this stitch 1 worked in row from the top down stitch increased sample shown mc clarence in color pop rocks yarn is not cut in between each row but p purl cc otebo bean in color electric youth is carried up the side of the shawl as you work pm place marker finished measurements shawl is bobble using an i-cord bobble on the ws for a visual tutorial check out this tbl through back loop approximately 78 / 195cm wingspan video https //youtu be/x8ssdfy1yp0 x 23 / 57 5cm deep along center rs right side spine s slip gauge sm slip marker while gauge is not crucial it will affect st s stitch es overall yardage used and the overall finished dimensions ws wrong side 16 stitches and 26 row = 4 in garter stitch using gauge needle blocked wyif with yarn in front wyib with yarn in back 1 directions for abbreviations shawl garter tab i-cord bobble note for a visual tutorial please see pattern notes with mc and gauge needle co 2 stitches knit 4 row do not turn with ws facing rejoin mc rotate 90° and pick up 1 stitch in the garter ridge bump along the side do not turn work i-cord bobble as follows rotate 90° and pick up 1 stitch in each of the 2 cast-on with mc and ws facing cable co 3 stitches stitches 5 stitches turn k2 k2tog-tbl s3 stitches back
